FuncDef:
The suppression enable command enables traffic suppression for a VLAN.
The undo suppression enable command disables traffic suppression for a VLAN.
By default, traffic suppression for a VLAN is disabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the upstream traffic is suppressed.
-

Indicates that the downstream traffic is suppressed.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The suppression enable command enables traffic suppression for a VLAN.
If traffic suppression has been enabled on an interface, traffic suppression is automatically enabled for the VLAN whose traffic is allowed by the interface, with no need to run this command in the VLAN view.
